restartWarningDialog.title: Restart Required
restartWarningDialog.description: After restarting, the opened private windows and private tabs will be lost.

search.title: Search Settings
search.searchResultsDescription: Search results for "{{query}}". Only {{productName}} settings are searched; Firefox settings are not included.

home.description: Manage your account, privacy, and security to enhance your {{productName}} experience.

setup.title: Setup
setup.setupDescription: Complete the setup to maximize your {{productName}} experience.

privacyAndTrackingProtection.title: Privacy and Tracking Protection
privacyAndTrackingProtection.description: {{productName}} protects your data and privacy by default, but you can also manage these settings manually.

ablazeAccount.title: Ablaze Account (Coming Soon)
ablazeAccount.description: Use a Mozilla Account to sync some data with other devices. Ablaze Account syncs data that can't be synced with a Mozilla Account.

manageExtensions.title: Manage Extensions
manageExtensions.description: {{productName}} allows you to manage extensions available on addons.mozilla.org.

browserSupport.title: {{productName}} Support
browserSupport.description: Access support documentation written by {{productName}} contributors.

design.customizePositionOfToolbars: Customize toolbar positions, tab bar style, and {{productName}}'s appearance.
design.interfaceDescription: Choose the interface design. "Lepton" is the default.
design.useFaviconColorToBackgroundOfNavigationB: Use Favicon Color for Navigation Bar Background
design.verticalTabIsRemovedFromBrowser: Vertical Tabs have been removed from {{productName}}. Please use Firefox's native Vertical Tab Bar instead.
design.showTabBarOnBottomOfNavigationBar: Show Tab Bar at Bottom of Navigation Bar
design.showTabBarOnBottomOfWindow: Show Tab Bar at Bottom of Window

tab.title: Tabs
tab.scrollDescription: Choose whether to use scrolling for tab switching and select scrolling behavior.
tab.scrollPrefInfo: "{{reverseScrollPrefName}}" & "{{scrollWrapPrefName}}" will only work if "{{scrollPrefName}}" is enabled.
tab.openPositionDescription: Specify where new tabs open. Following Firefox's behavior will vary the position based on how you open links.
tab.openLast: Open at the end of the tab bar
tab.openNext: Open next to the current tab
tab.minWidthError: Tab width must be between {{min}} and {{max}} pixels.
tab.minHeightError: Tab height must be between {{min}} and {{max}} pixels.

experimentalWarning.title: 丘멆잺 Experimental Features
experimentalWarning.description: These settings are experimental and not officially supported. Issues may occur.
experimentalWarning.leptonRepository: Lepton is a css theme for Firefox.

autohide.title: Auto-hide Settings
autohide.pageAction: Automatically hide buttons on the Address Bar

icon.title: Icon Settings
icon.disabled: Disable Lepton's context menu and panel menu icons

centered.title: Centered Settings
centered.urlbar: Center text in the Address Bar

urlView.title: URL View Settings
urlView.moveIconToLeft: Move Address Bar icons to the left side
urlView.alwaysShowPageActions: Always show page actions in the Address Bar

tabbar.title: Tab Bar Settings
tabbar.asTitlebar: Barra de pesta침as sobre barra de t칤tulo

tabSleepExclusion.title: Tab Sleep Exclusion
tabSleepExclusion.description: Exclude specific websites from tab sleep (unloading). Tabs matching these patterns will remain active and won't be automatically unloaded when memory is low.
tabSleepExclusion.patternsDescription: Add URL patterns to exclude from tab sleep. Tabs matching these patterns will not be unloaded.
tabSleepExclusion.noPatterns: No exclusion patterns configured. Add patterns to keep specific tabs active.
tabSleepExclusion.exampleDomain: Matches any URL containing this domain

uiCustomization.title: UI Customization
uiCustomization.needRestartDescriptionForEnableAndDisabl: A restart of {{productName}} is required to completely enable or disable this UI customization feature.

multirowTab.title: Multirow Tab
multirowTab.newtabInsideEnabled: Show new tab button inside tab bar

workspaces.howToUseAndCustomize: How to use and customize workspaces
workspaces.workspacesDescription: Workspaces greatly simplify the process of grouping tabs, making it easier to organize and manage your tabs.
workspaces.needRestartDescriptionForEnableAndDisabl: A restart of {{productName}} is required to completely enable or disable the workspace feature.
workspaces.enableWorkspacesDescription: Workspaces won't function even if this setting is enabled unless the workspace button is placed on the toolbar. Use this setting if you want to completely disable workspaces.
workspaces.closePopupWhenSelectingWorkspace: Close workspace popup when selecting a workspace
workspaces.closePopupWhenSelectingWorkspaceDescript: Choose whether to close the workspace popup when selecting a workspace.
workspaces.showWorkspaceNameOnToolbar: Show workspace name next to the icon
workspaces.exitOnLastTabClose: Exit {{productName}} when last workspace tab is closed
workspaces.manageOnBmsDescription: When this feature is enabled, you can only manage workspaces on the {{productName}} sidebar. You won't be able to manage workspaces using the toolbar button.
workspaces.initializeDescription: Reset workspace data to its default state. All custom workspaces will be removed and all tabs will be reassigned to the new workspace.
workspaces.initializeSuccess: Workspaces have been reset to their default state.
workspaces.initializeFailure: Failed to initialize workspaces. Please try again.
workspaces.initializeConfirmDescription: This removes all workspace data and recreates a single default workspace. Do you want to continue?

accounts.profileDescription: Profiles contain browsing-related information such as history, bookmarks, settings, and add-ons. {{productName}} uses this profile to save data.
accounts.profileManagementDescription: Profiles can be created and separated from each other, and their data is stored in the profile folder.
accounts.notSynced: Log in to Mozilla Account to enable sync feature

about.browserDescription: {{productName}} is a browser developed in Japan. It's built on Firefox under Ablaze to improve the web.
about.openSourceLicense: {{productName}} is open-source software available under the Mozilla Public License 2.0, made possible by the Firefox open-source project and other open-source software.

updates.title: Updates & Experiments
updates.description: Manage update settings and experimental features participation.

experiments.title: {{productName}} Flasco Participation
experiments.description: Control how {{productName}} enrolls you in experimental features and {{productName}} Flascos.

policyHelp.default: Follow the recommended participation policy. You may be enrolled in {{productName}} Flasco based on rollout percentages.
policyHelp.always: Always participate in all available {{productName}} Flascos. This option is for users who want to test new features early.
policyHelp.never: Never participate in {{productName}} Flascos. You will only receive stable, tested features.

experiments.confirmClearCache: Are you sure you want to clear all experiment data? This will reset your assignments and cannot be undone.
experiments.clearCacheDescription: If you are experiencing issues with experiments, clearing the cache may resolve them by resetting all experiment-related data to its initial state.

activeFlascos.title: Active {{productName}} Flascos
activeFlascos.description: View and manage your currently active Flasco enrollments.
activeFlascos.noFlascos: You are not currently enrolled in any Flascos.
activeFlascos.confirmDisable: Are you sure you want to disable this Flasco? You can re-enable it later.
activeFlascos.confirmEnable: Are you sure you want to re-enable this Flasco?

availableFlascos.title: Available Flascos
availableFlascos.description: All available Flascos for your {{productName}} version. Some may be unavailable due to rollout limits.
availableFlascos.confirmForceEnroll: Are you sure you want to enroll in this Flasco? This will override the rollout settings.
availableFlascos.confirmRemoveForceEnrollment: Remove enrollment and return to normal rollout behavior?

search.title: Search Settings
search.searchResultsDescription: Search results for "{{query}}". Only {{productName}} settings are searched; Firefox settings are not included.

panelSidebar.title: Panel Sidebar
panelSidebar.description: Panel Sidebar is a feature that allows you to display various tools, websites, and extensions on the side of the window. Here, you can customize, add, delete, and manage panels.
panelSidebar.howToUseAndCustomize: How to use and customize Panel Sidebar
panelSidebar.enableDescription: Panel Sidebar is different from Firefox's sidebar and won't interfere with it. Panel Sidebar can display web pages, unlike Firefox's sidebar. You can also manage workspaces in the sidebar.
panelSidebar.globalWidthDescription: Global width is applied when panel width is set to 0.
panelSidebar.iconProviderRemoved: The icon provider setting has been removed as {{productName}} now tries to get panel icons directly from web pages when possible.
panelSidebar.needRestartDescriptionForEnableAndDisabl: {{productName}}'s restart is required to completely enable or disable the panel sidebar feature.
panelSidebar.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete this panel?

errors.urlRequired: URL is required for web panels
errors.extensionIdRequired: Extension ID is required for extension panels
errors.invalidWidth: Width must be at least 100 pixels

progressiveWebApp.title: Web Apps
progressiveWebApp.description: Manage your installed Web Apps and their settings
progressiveWebApp.enablePwaDescription: Allow websites to be installed as desktop apps
progressiveWebApp.needRestartDescriptionForEnableAndDisabl: {{productName}}'s restart is required to completely enable or disable the progressive web app feature.
progressiveWebApp.showToolbarDescription: Display the toolbar in Progressive Web App windows
progressiveWebApp.uninstallWarning: Are you sure you want to uninstall "{{name}}"?

floorpOS.title: {{productName}} OS
floorpOS.description: Manage {{productName}} OS backend modules and services

mouseGesture.description: Control your browser with mouse movements.
mouseGesture.enabledDescription: Allows you to control your browser with mouse movements
mouseGesture.showTrailDescription: Draw a line following your mouse movements
mouseGesture.showLabelDescription: Display the action name during gesture
mouseGesture.minDistanceDescription: Minimum movement distance to be recognized as a gesture
mouseGesture.preventionTimeoutDescription: Time to suppress right-click menu after gesture
mouseGesture.trailSettingsDescription: Customize the appearance of gesture trails.
mouseGesture.trailWidthDescription: Width of the gesture trail line
mouseGesture.name: Name
mouseGesture.rockerGesturesDescription: Right-click and move left to go back, right-click and move right to go forward. (Experimental)

keyboardShortcut.description: Customize keyboard shortcuts for various browser actions.
keyboardShortcut.enableDescription: When enabled, you can customize keyboard shortcuts for various browser actions. When disabled, default Firefox shortcuts will be used.
keyboardShortcut.needRestartDescription: A restart of {{productName}} is required to completely enable or disable the custom keyboard shortcuts feature.
keyboardShortcut.shortcutsDescription: Configure keyboard shortcuts for various browser actions
keyboardShortcut.shortcutsTip: Some shortcuts may conflict with Firefox's default shortcuts.
keyboardShortcut.keyConflict: This shortcut is already in use
keyboardShortcut.keyConflictDescription: Please choose a different shortcut or remove the existing one first.
keyboardShortcut.noModifierDescription: Please select at least one modifier key.

modal.title: Edit Shortcut
modal.description: Enter the key you want to use and select the modifier keys to combine them.
